meanings.definition: To plan together secretly to commit an illegal or wrongful act.
meanings.sent1: The group conspires to steal the treasure from the museum.
meanings.sent2: The criminals conspire to rob the bank under the cover of darkness.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous raccoons conspire to raid the picnic basket when no one is looking.
meanings.sent4: The shadows of the night conspire with the thieves to cloak their movements.
meanings.sent5: The whispers of the wind conspire with the leaves to hide the footsteps of the intruders.

meanings.definition: To act in harmony towards a common end.
meanings.sent1: The team conspires to win the championship by practicing diligently.
meanings.sent2: The birds conspire to build their nests together in the tall tree.
meanings.sent3: The ingredients in the recipe conspire to create a delicious aroma in the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: The waves of the ocean conspire to carry the lost ship safely to shore.
meanings.sent5: The stars in the sky conspire to guide the lost travelers on their journey.

meanings.sent1: The villains conspire to overthrow the king and seize the throne.
meanings.sent2: The evil sorcerer conspires to cast a spell on the kingdom.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat conspires to knock over the vase on the table.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds conspire to bring a storm upon the unsuspecting town.
meanings.sent5: The rival spies conspire to outwit each other in a game of deception.
